definition: to whom the deer falls (idiom); the one to emerge victor (i.e. to seize the empire)/prize winner/champion
deer
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned
who/also pr. [shui2]
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Watch June 13th on CBS to see who wins.
sentences.chinese: 请关注六月十三日的CBS看鹿死谁手。

sentences.english: Yet with a week to go before polling day, it is anybody's guess who will win.
sentences.chinese: 距离投票日还有一周时间，每个人都在猜测鹿死谁手。

sentences.english: Tonight's semifinals match is too close to call.
sentences.chinese: 今晚半决赛中究竟鹿死谁手还难以知晓。

sentences.english: Trilingual deer skin is rare, the outcome will become a hero.
sentences.chinese: 皮肉俱佳的鹿实在难得，鹿死谁手谁就成了英雄。

definition: victory or defeat/the outcome of a battle
two tigers fighting (idiom); fierce contest between evenly matched adversaries
the result (becomes apparent)/now one understands
lit. to wipe one's eyes and wait (idiom); to wait and see
the best part of the show is yet to come/(with ironic tone) the worst is yet to come/you ain't seen nothin' yet
pinyin: hao3 xi4 hai2 zai4 hou4 tou5

definition: a tie-break/to determine the winner
to have a show-down/to fight for mastery/to compete for a championship
to pit oneself against sb/to compete with sb/contest/battle/to haggle/to quibble
to strive
lit. you die, I live (idiom); irreconcilable adversaries/two parties cannot coexist
see 一決雌雄|一决雌雄[yi1 jue2 ci2 xiong2]
great heroes pursue deer in the central plains (idiom); fig. many vie for supremacy
grasp it and victory is assured/to have success within one's grasp (idiom)
to vie against one another/to fight each other/mutual aggression
confrontation/contest/showdown
both sides suffer (idiom)/neither side wins
